name: Architecture and Landmarks
description: Human civilization's architectural achievements across different eras and regions, reflecting the evolution of culture and technology.

groups.name: Ancient Greek and Roman Architecture
groups.description: Characterized by the use of columns and arches, grand and rich in classical beauty.

groups.name: Traditional Chinese Architecture
groups.description: Featuring flying eaves and wooden structures, the essence of Eastern traditional architecture.

groups.name: Gothic Cathedrals
groups.description: Interwoven with pointed towers and stained glass, a masterpiece of religious art.

groups.name: Islamic Style
groups.description: Represented by domes and arches, Middle Eastern flair architecture.

groups.name: Contemporary Skyscrapers
groups.description: The modern city skyline forged from steel and concrete.

groups.name: Urban Skyline
groups.description: The grand outline of a metropolis composed of multiple landmark buildings.

groups.name: Temples and Palaces
groups.description: Religious or royal buildings, often with lavish decorations and history.

groups.name: European Medieval Castles
groups.description: Thick castle walls and pointed towers, combining defense and art.

groups.name: World Famous Landmarks
groups.description: Global icons such as the Eiffel Tower and the Statue of Liberty.

groups.name: Bridges Across the Sea
groups.description: Majestic bridge engineering projects connecting shores or sea bays.

groups.name: Traditional Folk Houses
groups.description: Local residential forms preserved in various folk cultures.

groups.name: Ancient Ruins
groups.description: Building remnants weathered by history.

groups.name: Waterborne Architecture
groups.description: Structures built on or under water, combining functionality and aesthetics.

groups.name: Small Town Charm
groups.description: European or other regional small town architecture and streets with unique characteristics.

groups.name: Industrial Architecture
groups.description: Factory buildings, chimneys, and other industrial era architectural forms.

groups.name: Sculptures and Memorials
groups.description: Urban landmarks commemorating important individuals or events.

groups.name: Gardens and Parks
groups.description: Green spaces designed to integrate human habitation with nature.

groups.name: Modern Minimalist Architecture
groups.description: Simple lines, functionality prioritized, highlighting contemporary design principles.

groups.name: Western Countryside Villas
groups.description: Cozy residences nestled in rural landscapes.

groups.name: Asian Temple Pagodas
groups.description: Common religious architectural styles in East Asia or Southeast Asia.

groups.name: Underground Architecture (Mines, etc.)
groups.description: Man-made spaces or natural caves hidden beneath the earth's surface.

groups.name: Wooden Structure Architecture
groups.description: Using wood as the primary material, rustic and warm.

groups.name: Brick and Stone Structure Architecture
groups.description: Durable, often seen in castles, palaces, and traditional Chinese old houses.

groups.name: Coastal Cities
groups.description: The architectural layout and harbor atmosphere of coastal areas.
